title: NASA Webb, Hubble Scientist Marcia Rieke Awarded Gruber Cosmology Prize
summary: Marcia Rieke, a scientist who worked on NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope and Hubble Space Telescope, has received the Gruber Foundation’s 2024 Cosmology Prize. Rieke will receive the award and gold laureate pin at a ceremony August 8, 2024, at the General Assembly of the International Astronomical Union in Cape Town, South Africa. Rieke was […]

title: Skynopy raises funds for scalable ground station network
summary: Skynopy has raised $3.1 million to break into the ground satellite services market by leveraging underutilized infrastructure from constellation operators, the eight-month-old French startup announced June 24.

title: On the GOES
summary: On June 14, 2024, NOAA’s (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) last Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite, GOES-U, started its journey from the Astrotech Space Operations facility to the SpaceX hangar at Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida. GOES-U is the final weather-observing and environmental monitoring satellite in NOAA’s GOES-R Series. GOES-U will […]

title: Europe aims to end space access crisis with Ariane 6’s inaugural launch
summary: Q&A with Toni Tolker-Nielsen, ESA Director of Space Transportation.

title: Webb captures star clusters in Cosmic Gems arc
summary: An international team of astronomers have used the NASA/ESA/CSA James Webb Space Telescope to discover gravitationally bound star clusters when the Universe was 460 million years old. This is the first discovery of star clusters in an infant galaxy less than 500 million years after the Big Bang.

title: ESA astronaut class of 2022: Astro Chat with John McFall
summary: John McFall, a member of the European astronaut reserve from the ESA astronaut class of 2022, brings a diverse background to his role. With experience as an orthopaedic and trauma surgeon and a former Paralympic sprinter, John is participating in the groundbreaking "Fly!" feasibility study. This initiative seeks to enhance our comprehension of the challenges posed by space flight for astronauts with physical disabilities, aiming to overcome these barriers. Tune in to discover more about John and the "Fly!" project.

title: China may need to adjust its approach toward SpaceX
summary: China's comparisons between its space program and SpaceX's launch capabilities may be short-sighted compared to the achievements of the country.

title: Two large asteroids safely pass Earth just 42 hours apart
summary: Two large asteroids will safely pass Earth this week, a rare occurrence perfectly timed to commemorate this year's Asteroid Day. Neither poses any risk to our planet, but one of them was only discovered a week ago, highlighting the need to continue improving our ability to detect potentially hazardous object in our cosmic neighbourhood.

title: Exercise examines response to long-term asteroid impact threat
summary: A recent planetary defense exercise highlighted a different set of challenges governments would face about a threatening asteroid in a scenario where the impact is many years in the future.
